{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536288,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T14:00:44.484Z","cooked":"

We have updated our radio, set up the team number and all that. Even after doing all that, we can’t find our robot’s Wi-Fi. Does anyone know of a solution?

Do you have a picture of your wiring?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T14:11:55.980Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":46.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Carter Ryba","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65624,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9764, 10219"},"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/2","custom_user_title":"9764, 10219","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536292,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T14:19:22.958Z","cooked":"

Unlike the old white openmesh radios, the new radios operate on a different frequency and out of the box you won’t be able to “just see” the radio SSID with your laptop.

You need to use a 2ed robot radio connected to your driverstation, or a different setup described here to connect wirelessly with your robot.

Is that for long range connections? because I have the robot here with me?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T16:25:35.568Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":17.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Mason ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536429,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T17:00:09.334Z","cooked":"

The page I linked covers various wireless connection topologies.

Can you do what you want to do by tethering? Plugging your PC into the radio??

If you need a wireless connection you need to pick a topology as that previous link - typically using a 2ed robot radio as an access point connected to your driverstation laptop, or turning on the 2.4ghz radio which if you search CD you will find has mixed results/typically has reduced performance or experienced drops due to heat and your wireless environment.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T17:00:09.334Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":71720,"username":"9453_MSH","name":"Mason ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536455,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T17:19:32.819Z","cooked":"

What I’m hearing is: we need to go through extra steps to connect wirelessly, but we can do everything we want to do [driving and CAN stuff] through a wired connection directly through the bot? Then at competitions they’ll already have gone through the extra steps?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T17:19:32.819Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Mason ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536638,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T20:05:07.758Z","cooked":"

At competition there will be a radio programming kiosk that will link your radio to the event.

You can still set up ahead of time and test at home to make sure that the rest of the control system is set up and working.

But let’s backup.

What do you want to do and why?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T20:05:07.758Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":13.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":71720,"username":"9453_MSH","name":"Mason ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536662,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T20:24:23.256Z","cooked":"

We really don’t know what we want. We know we need to assign CAN id’s, and get the code working. We’ve been using Pheonix Tuner to get our CAN working. We can’t test the code for our swerve drive.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T20:24:23.256Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":13.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Mason ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536677,"name":"Louis Harnish","username":"LouisHarnish","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/louisharnish/{size}/251955_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T20:39:48.272Z","cooked":"

On the back of the radio, there should be a panel of switches. Flip switch 3 to on and it will flip the wifi output from 6G (unreachable from pc) to 2.4G (reachable). or you can use 2 radios to communicate through 6G and ethernet it to your pc.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T20:49:02.585Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":72.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492697,"topic_slug":"unable-to-find-robots-wifi","display_username":"Louis Harnish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":71720,"username":"9453_MSH","name":"Mason ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62540,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/unable-to-find-robots-wifi/492697/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536682,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T20:58:22.821Z","cooked":"

We can now see the wifi on our computers, thank you. We’re having trouble connecting to the wifi. I’m sure I just have the password wrong, but if you know of another issue that would be great.

was wondering if teams have begun testing different bumper materials following the 2025 rules.
